item.description:
Please join us for a special potluck and guest presentation by Mark Follansbee of WormMainea! Learn how to turn your kitchen scraps into gold (and keep that organic material out of the "waste" stream!).

Portland location (TBD) 6:30 potluck and 7:00 announcements + presentation | wrap-up around 8:30pm
Don't forget to bring your potluck kit (plate/utensils/cup/napkin) and a dish to share for supper!

From Mark:

Composting builds soil and conserves resources, but outdoor composting
in winter is a challenge. Indoor composting with worms is a great
solution. Mark Follansbee (WormMainea) will demonstrate how easy it is
to get started. In addition to a hands on how to, you will learn how
to build a worm bin for less than $15 and keep your bin trouble-free.
Mark will also cover feeding and monitoring your bin; harvesting worm
compost as a soil amendment; and making worm compost tea. There will
be time to answer questions and address rumors and myths about
vermicomposting. Mark will have compost worms and worm bins available
for purchase, as well as free instructions available. About me: I have
a PhD in Pharmacology and work in Scarborough as an environmental
scientist/toxicologist. I have been vermicomposting since 2000 and, as
a hobby, I operate WormMainea. I have been teaching others to
vermicompost successfully since 2005.

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Vermicomposting with Mark Follansbee
